availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: De Witt Clinton Rowland (Railroad Superintendent, Louisville)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, railroad superintendent. Hartford, Connecticut, native. Married to Eliza Page Rowland. Father of Cliff W. Rowland and John B. A. Rowland. Worked as conductor and master of transportation on the Mobile & Ohio Railroad and the Tennessee & Alabama Railroad. Appointed assistant superintendent of Military Railroads, Department of the Cumberland. Served as general superintendent of the army freight line in Louisville and assistant superintendent of the Louisville & Nashville Railroad.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferswon County, Louisville, 8th Ward, p. 50.
“D. W. C. Rowland Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), July 22, 1894, p. 8.
E. H. Talbott and H. R. Hobart, eds., The Biographical Directory of the Railway Officials of America (Chicago and New York: The Railway Age Publishing Company, 1885), 210-211.
